TextSection.Contents: A rare neurologic disease with psychiatric involvement characterized by prominent pre-psychotic developmental disabilities (cognitive language motor) socio-communicative disturbances auditory hallucinations (visual and tactile hallucinations are rarer) preceding psychotic symptoms presenting before 13 years of age. Co-occurrence of neurodevelopmental disorders (e.g. autism spectrum disorders attention deficit hyperactivity disorder) is frequent. Disease course is more severe than adult-onset form of the disease with major neurodevelopmental impact.

Parent.Label: Rare neurologic disease with psychiatric involvement
